location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, informs Francis Warden that he has sent on board the Honourable Company cruiser, the Ternate,dispatches received from His Britannic Majesty's Chargé d’Affaires, Henry Willock, which are addressed to the following: His Excellency Francis Rawdon-Hastings; the Governor in Council of Bombay, Mountstuart Elphinstone; Francis Warden. In addition, Dow sends a copy of a letter that he has received from Andrew Jukes, Political Agent in Persia.
